events.name: North Korea Denies Supplying Arms to Russia
events.wd_label: North Korea Denies Supplying Arms to Russia
events.wd_description: North Korea denied allegations made by the United States that it has supplied artillery shells to Russia for the war in Ukraine, stating that it has never engaged in arms dealings with Russia and has no plans to do so.
events.description: North Korea denied allegations made by the United States that it has supplied artillery shells to Russia for the war in Ukraine, stating that it has never engaged in arms dealings with Russia and has no plans to do so.

events.name: US Allegations
events.wd_description: The White House, through National Security Spokesperson John Kirby, alleged that North Korea is supplying Russia with a significant number of artillery shells for its war in Ukraine.
events.description: The White House, through National Security Spokesperson John Kirby, alleged that North Korea is supplying Russia with a significant number of artillery shells for its war in Ukraine.

events.name: North Korean Denial
events.wd_description: North Korea's Defense Ministry denied the US allegations, stating that the country has never engaged in arms dealings with Russia and has no plans to do so in the future.
events.description: North Korea's Defense Ministry denied the US allegations, stating that the country has never engaged in arms dealings with Russia and has no plans to do so in the future.

events.name: Context of Ukraine Conflict
events.wd_description: North Korea, one of the few countries to recognize the independence of breakaway Ukrainian regions, has supported Russia's annexation of parts of Ukraine.
events.description: North Korea, one of the few countries to recognize the independence of breakaway Ukrainian regions, has supported Russia's annexation of parts of Ukraine.

events.name: North Korean Missile Launch Over Japan
events.wd_label: North Korean Missile Launch Over Japan
events.wd_description: North Korea fired at least one ballistic missile over Japan, marking a potential escalation and the 23rd missile launch by North Korea this year.
events.description: North Korea fired at least one ballistic missile over Japan, marking a potential escalation and the 23rd missile launch by North Korea this year.

events.name: Missile Launch
events.wd_description: North Korea launched a ballistic missile over Japan, with the missile reportedly passing over the northern Japanese island of Hokkaido.
events.description: North Korea launched a ballistic missile over Japan, with the missile reportedly passing over the northern Japanese island of Hokkaido.

events.name: Japanese Government Response
events.wd_description: The Japanese government issued a warning to civilians to avoid suspicious objects and to report them to authorities, following the missile's trajectory over Japan.
events.description: The Japanese government issued a warning to civilians to avoid suspicious objects and to report them to authorities, following the missile's trajectory over Japan.

events.name: Regional Reactions
events.wd_description: The missile launch, confirmed by South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff, marked a rare event of a missile being fired over Japan, raising regional tensions.
events.description: The missile launch, confirmed by South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff, marked a rare event of a missile being fired over Japan, raising regional tensions.

events.name: Dismissal of Germany's Cybersecurity Chief
events.wd_description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.
events.description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.

events.name: Dismissal of Schönbohm
events.wd_description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.
events.description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.

events.name: Allegations of Russian Connections
events.wd_description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.
events.description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.

events.name: Public Scrutiny
events.wd_description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.
events.description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.

events.name: BNEF Global Lithium-Ion Battery Supply Chain Ranking Report
events.wd_label: BNEF Global Lithium-Ion Battery Supply Chain Ranking Report
events.wd_description: China continues to dominate BloombergNEF's (BNEF) global lithium-ion battery supply chain ranking, while Canada rises to the second spot, and the US drops to third, with other countries implementing policies to support battery demand and raw material supply.
events.description: China continues to dominate BloombergNEF's (BNEF) global lithium-ion battery supply chain ranking, while Canada rises to the second spot, and the US drops to third, with other countries implementing policies to support battery demand and raw material supply.

events.name: China’s Dominance
events.wd_description: China remains the top-ranked country for the third consecutive year in BNEF’s lithium-ion battery supply chain ranking, hosting 75% of all battery cell manufacturing capacity and leading in anode and electrolyte production.
events.description: China remains the top-ranked country for the third consecutive year in BNEF’s lithium-ion battery supply chain ranking, hosting 75% of all battery cell manufacturing capacity and leading in anode and electrolyte production.

events.name: Canada’s Rise
events.wd_description: Canada rose to the second spot in the ranking, reflecting its large raw material resources, mining activity, and strong performance in ESG and infrastructure, innovation, and industry.
events.description: Canada rose to the second spot in the ranking, reflecting its large raw material resources, mining activity, and strong performance in ESG and infrastructure, innovation, and industry.

events.name: US Position
events.wd_description: The US dropped to third place despite strong battery demand and the benefits of the Inflation Reduction Act, which is expected to change the supply landscape and increase production capacity.
events.description: The US dropped to third place despite strong battery demand and the benefits of the Inflation Reduction Act, which is expected to change the supply landscape and increase production capacity.

events.name: European Trends
events.wd_description: Most European countries declined in their rankings, with Finland and Czechia being exceptions. Finland placed highest in Europe due to its growing battery metals supply chain and clean grid.
events.description: Most European countries declined in their rankings, with Finland and Czechia being exceptions. Finland placed highest in Europe due to its growing battery metals supply chain and clean grid.

events.name: South American Declines
events.wd_description: South American countries, notably Brazil and Bolivia, saw declines in their rankings due to poor ESG performance and lack of domestic battery manufacturing capabilities.
events.description: South American countries, notably Brazil and Bolivia, saw declines in their rankings due to poor ESG performance and lack of domestic battery manufacturing capabilities.

events.name: Resource-Rich Countries
events.wd_description: Resource-rich countries like Indonesia, Chile, South Africa, and the Democratic Republic of Congo are seeking to attract downstream investment to build domestic lithium-ion battery supply chains.
events.description: Resource-rich countries like Indonesia, Chile, South Africa, and the Democratic Republic of Congo are seeking to attract downstream investment to build domestic lithium-ion battery supply chains.
